body_html:
A few comments:

  • Let's use absolute path when including files. https://google.github.io/styleguide/cppguide.html#Names_and_Order_of_Includes
  • For .cpp files whose purpose is purely to include .h file, could you educate me on why? Seems that there is no effect. This does not seem to be the coding practice that Facebook uses so we may not want that.
  • Quite a few contents seem to be emulating standard stl containers. Is there a reason to have custom ones? Can we put more docs since we are expecting C10 to stay and doc would be much helpful?
body_text:
A few comments:

Let's use absolute path when including files. https://google.github.io/styleguide/cppguide.html#Names_and_Order_of_Includes
For .cpp files whose purpose is purely to include .h file, could you educate me on why? Seems that there is no effect. This does not seem to be the coding practice that Facebook uses so we may not want that.
Quite a few contents seem to be emulating standard stl containers. Is there a reason to have custom ones? Can we put more docs since we are expecting C10 to stay and doc would be much helpful?
body:
A few comments:

- Let's use absolute path when including files. https://google.github.io/styleguide/cppguide.html#Names_and_Order_of_Includes
- For .cpp files whose purpose is purely to include .h file, could you educate me on why? Seems that there is no effect. This does not seem to be the coding practice that Facebook uses so we may not want that.
- Quite a few contents seem to be emulating standard stl containers. Is there a reason to have custom ones? Can we put more docs since we are expecting C10 to stay and doc would be much helpful?
